results.question: What complications are associated with CHIKV?
results.ground_truth_answer: Complications associated with CHIKV include respiratory failure, cardiovascular decompensation, meningoencephalitis, severe acute hepatitis, severe cutaneous effects, other central nervous system problems, and kidney failure.
results.generated_response: Complications associated with CHIKV include, from most to least common: respiratory failure, cardiovascular decompensation, meningoencephalitis, severe acute hepatitis, severe cutaneous effects, other central nervous system problems, and kidney failure.

results.question: What is Bacillus subtilis?
results.ground_truth_answer: Bacillus subtilis is a species of bacteria that has been shown to be effective in the prevention and/or treatment of intestinal diseases such as diarrhea, colitis, irritable bowel syndrome, irritable bowel disease, and colorectal cancer. It is also a part of the normal intestinal microbiome and has been found in the healthy human gastrointestinal tract. Bacillus subtilis produces surfactins, fengycins, and iturins, which have antimicrobial and antiviral properties.
results.generated_response: Bacillus subtilis is a spore-forming bacterium that naturally resides in the human gut, where it helps maintain gut barrier integrity, reduces endotoxin levels, and lowers inflammation. It produces antimicrobial lipopeptides (surfactins, fengycins, iturins) that modulate immune responses and suppress harmful microbes. As a probiotic, B. subtilis restores beneficial gut microflora and has shown efficacy against intestinal disorders such as diarrhea, colitis, and colorectal cancer.

In food industry, lactobacilli are applied as starter cultures in the production of fermented milk products, cheese, sausages, bread, kimchi, pickles, and yogurts, the latter accounting for the largest share of sales . results.question: What's the recommended procedure to disinfect at CT scanner after a COVID-19 exposure?
results.ground_truth_answer: The recommended procedure to disinfect a CT scanner after a COVID-19 exposure involves sterilization procedures, noncontaminated CT disinfection procedures, and immediate disinfection of the imaging equipment after the examination.

results.question: What can RNA sequencing be used to monitor?
results.ground_truth_answer: RNA sequencing can be used to monitor transcripts that may not be in the existing genomic annotation, allowing the search for novel transcripts, and even identification of SNPs and other variants, as well as for transcriptome profiling in cancers such as breast cancer, gastrointestinal tumors, and prostate cancer.

Labeling remained well-restricted to the expected corticostriatal circuits at 5 dpi, suggesting that viral spread becomes less efficient after crossing one or two connections, consistent with injections into V1 . While glial cells can be infected and were observed near the injection site , infected glial cells away from the injection site generally were not observed. Title: Vesicular stomatitis virus with the rabies virus glycoprotein directs retrograde transsynaptic transport among neurons in vivo
Passage: dpi, as previously observed .
